newsitem.title: USA: Accelr8 to conduct Year 2000 analysis.
newsitem.headline: Accelr8 to conduct Year 2000 analysis.

text.p: Accelr8 Technology Corp on Tuesday said it won a contract to analyse how an insurance company's customer-service computer application would react to a potential glitch in reading dates beginning with the year 2000.
It did not disclose terms of the contract or the name of the insurance company.
Accelr8 is among companies specializing in fixing the so-called Year 2000 bug, a software glitch in many computers making them unable to recognize dates beginning with the year 2000 and beyond.

It said the insurance company's customer-service application consists of more than 1.2 million lines of code written in VAX COBOL and C, and uses proprietary VMS tools including DCL, COBOL copybooks and SQL modules.
